ability.name: Water Immunity
ability.text: You can't attach Water Energy cards from your hand to Articuno.

attacks.name: Freeze Solid
attacks.text: If there are any Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Articuno.

attacks.name: Ice Cyclone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Pokémon in play. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Freeze Lock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Active Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Crushing Ice
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost. Damage is calculated using the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost after applying effects to the Retreat Cost.

ability.name: Self Healing
ability.text: Whenever you attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Jolteon, remove all Special Conditions affecting Jolteon.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderspark
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon with at least 1 Energy card attached to it (yours and your opponent's).

ability.name: Attract Energy
ability.text: When you play Magneton from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may move any number of basic Energy cards attached to your other Pokémon to Magneton.

attacks.name: Electric Blast
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy cards attached to Magneton when you use this attack. If you do, put damage counters equal to the amount of Energy cards removed in this way on any number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon in the way you like. (For example, if you discard 3 Energy cards, you can put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and 2 on another.)

ability.name: Strange Spiral
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack), if Poliwrath if your Active Pokémon, you may discard a basic Energy card attached to Poliwrath. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. This power can't be used if Poliwrath is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

ability.name: Dark Gaze
ability.text: As long as Umbreon is your Active Pokémon, Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's) can't use Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: Dark Gaze
ability.text: As long as Umbreon is your Active Pokémon, Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's) can't use Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Electrode.

attacks.name: Self destruct
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon) Electrode does 100 damage to itself.

cards.name: Cleffa
text: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Energy Recycle
attacks.text: Shuffle a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leek Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Teary Eyes
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Ledyba is reduced by 20.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any basic Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and move it to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

attacks.name: Foresight
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Removal Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose one of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.name: Max Voltage
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Baby Pokémon or Basic Pokémon and put it onto your bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack it your bench is full.)

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Teddiursa.

attacks.name: Bear Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't Retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If not, this attack does 40 damage.

attacks.name: Magnetic Pull
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spin Tackle
attacks.text: Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Mystery Plate Delta
text: If your opponent has 5 or more Prizes, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If your opponent has exactly 2 Prizes, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

ability.name: Crystal Type
ability.text: Whenever you attach a Grass, Water, or Psychic basic Energy card from your hand to Celebi, Celebi's type (color) becomes the same as that type of energy until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Empathetic Healing
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Celebi and each Pokémon that's the same type (color) as Celebi.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Crystal Type
ability.text: Whenever you attach a Water, Lightning, or Fighting basic Energy card from your hand to Kabutops, Kabutop's type (color) becomes the same as that type of energy until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Draining Cut
attacks.text: Remove a damage counter from Kabutops.

attacks.name: Triple Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Carry Off
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack) you may flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent has and Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, of Evolution cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Crobat is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Double Cross
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. If both of them are tails, the defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

ability.name: Manipulate
ability.text: When you play Gengar from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may put a Basic Pokémon (excluding Baby Pokémon) from your discard pile onto your bench. Then flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydrokinesis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Flame Vapor
ability.text: When you play Gyarados from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon's Vengeance
attacks.text: If Gyarados has 7 or more damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 100.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Ledian can't become affected by a Special Condition. (Any other effect of attacks, Poké

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Streaming Mantle
ability.text: When you play Magcargo from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may discard the top 3 cards of your deck and then shuffle 3 basic energy cards from your discard pile into your deck. If you do, your opponent must do the same.

attacks.name: Crushing Lava
attacks.text: You may discard a or basic Energy card attached to Magcargo. If you discard a Energy card in this way, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If you discard a Energy card in this way, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Primal Stare
ability.text: As long as Omastar is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spook
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

ability.name: Self Healing
ability.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Vaporeon, remove all Special Conditions affecting Vaporeon.

attacks.name: Hypnosplash
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Aqua Trick
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and move it to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

ability.name: Thick Shell
ability.text: All damage done by attacks to Kabuto from Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done by attacks to Diglett during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attack still happen.)

ability.name: Slippery Skin
ability.text: As long as the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, Dunsparce's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Tail Shake
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Energy Patch
attacks.text: Take a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Syncroblast
attacks.text: If Girafarig and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards attached to them, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 40.

cards.name: Igglybuff
text: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Poison Sound Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Retaliate

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Threaten
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card back into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Antler Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance) If tails, your and opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Healing Dust
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. If a Pokémon has fewer damage counters than the number of heads, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition (Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned). The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Mystery Plate Gamma
text: If your opponent has 5 or more Prizes, shuffle your hand into your deck and then draw 6 cards. If your opponent has exactly 2 Prizes, choose 1 of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. Your opponent puts the top card on that Evolved Pokémon on the bottom of his or her deck. (This counts as devolving that Pokémon.)

cards.name: Mystery Zone
text: Once during each player's turn (before he or she attacks), if that player has an Evolution card in his or her hand, he or she may search his or her deck for a basic Energy card, show it to his or her opponent, and put it into his or her hand. Then that player chooses an Evolution card from his or her hand, shows it to his or her opponent, and puts it into his or her deck. That player shuffles his or her deck afterward.

cards.name: Miracle Sphere Alpha
text: If the Pokémon using this attack has and Energy cards attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If the Pokémon using this attack has and basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage and removes 3 damage counters from the Pokémon that Miracle Sphere alpha is attached to.

attacks.text: If Magneton and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards attached to them, the player controlling the Active Pokémon with the fewest number of Energy cards attached to it switches 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magnetic Wave
